text: Went for lunch recently , Nice meal! Good quality , A bit on the pricy side especially considering the portions aren't hugely filling. But if you get a soup and/or dessert (the desserts rock btw) you will be OK.  The menu is small here.  You may have to ask specifically for bread, the server didn't bring any , but happily provided some on request.  He only thing is that Service is extremely slow...... slow for taking your order, slow for bringing your food (we waited over a half hour- they apologized but still ...) and our meals were not very complicated, salads , smoked salmon etc. Another nearly half hour to get the bill, and so on and so forth.
Beau Resto, beau menu, mais la qualité des assiettes n'y est pas.  Pour le prix, on s'attend à plus.  Pas sur que je vais y retourner pour le souper, je crois que davantage un Resto pour le midi.

Le café a récemment ouvert a Centropolis et est adjacent a une boutique d'articles de cuisine et de deco de table. Tres bel endroit aux lignes simples et accueillantes. Le menu n'est pas tres long ce qui généralement est bon signe. Je ne sais pas si il change souvent ou pas. Un consommateur 'classique' y trouvera certainement son bonheur rapidement, un consommateur 'a allergies alimentaires ' devra s'enquérir auprès des serveurs sur ce qui est ok ou ce qui doit être adapté. Globalement les plats étaient présentés de manière originale et les assiettes d'allure fraiche et santé, pas ideal pour une allergie au gluten cependant.  J'ai trouvé la facture élevée pour un café. Les entrées sont aux alentour de 10-15$ et les plats autour de 20$. Les cocktails et verres de vin proches de 10$. Les desserts sont nombreux a choisir dans la vitrine (des gâteaux entiers peuvent être amenés a la maison) et c'est probablement la partie la plus sympa pour beaucoup. Si nous revenons ce sera surement juste pour un dessert et une boisson chaude, des options sans gluten etant disponibles.
Ricardo tout simplement. Bon et gourmet (le prix va avec). Ça vaut la peine de prendre un petit café et gâteau après un peu de shopping dans la boutique.

Bel endroit à la déco sobre, moderne avec beaucoup d'attention aux détails.  Les hauts plafonds rendent malheureusement l'endroit écho et bruyant comme bien des restos du Centropolis.  C'est tendance et populaire donc un peu cher mais les portions et la qualité des produits sont adéquats.  J'ai particulièrement aimé le gâteau chiffon au citron qui était moelleux, savoureux et pas trop sucré.  Les plats salés ne me donne pas trop envie surtout par rapport au prix mais j'essaierai peut-être question de me faire une opinion.  J'avoue ne pas être fan de ce genre d'endroit pour se faire voir et être vu...

The Café recently opened this week at the espace Rocardo. The menu is a typical café menu with light meals and various drinks and desserts. The items seem all quite delicious with lots of local and quality ingredients. I had a delicious grilled cheese with pulled ham, mustard grains sliced apples and a touch of maple. The decor is nice and fresh with convenient access to the Ricardo kitchen supply store next door

As a fan of Ricardo, I had to try out his cafe. The menu is small but changes seasonally. Nice choices and everything is executed and presented with care. Easy to book a table online. The cafe gets quite loud when it's full but I don't mind. I like that it is adjacent to a ricardo store. The only downside are the prices. I found it pretty pricy for the portions and keeping in mind that ricardo aims to make his recipes accessible to everyone regardless of background. The meals/desserts are all based on his own recipes.
They have a very good delicious dessert but the customer service is very bad, the staff and the regulations  are very tuff and not friendly and professional at all

We were invited to a VIP dinner hosted by Investors Group.  It was a delight to actually see live the Chef Isabelle putting her dazzling magical touch to showcase a beautiful dessert - fresh cream , white chocolate, rhubarb amongst a myriad of other ingredients.   We were in great company with our hosts, Marie-Stephanie and Tracey who indulged us with their charm during the entire evening.    Food presentation was the highlight of our dinner,  starting with a tuna tartar appetizer, pork pieces nicely drowned in a rich sauce and ending with a white chocolate mousse, all elegantly dressed, partnering with other goodies creating a vivid harmony of colours.  Wine was somewhat below par, but nevertheless cannot look at a gift horse in the mouth.   There is a store attached to the restaurant which has all the Ricardo brand kitchen utensils you can think of.    Everything during the evening was as expected with the brand name Ricardo.

Being fans of Ricardo, my friend and I decided to try his cafe for brunch last Sunday. It's only 15min from downtown Montreal by car, and it was nice to get outside the city. The place is nice, with one side of the shop where you can buy many things like kitchen supplies, chocolate, and ice cream. The other side is the cafe. I had the smoked salmon bagel, which was delicious but I was a bit disappointed with the size of the dish. I don't eat much in general, yet I still felt the portions were a bit small. My friend got the indian bowl, which is a vegetarian salad mixed with different marinated vegetables, spinach, and curcuma garbanzo beans. It was full of color and the flavors were well balanced. To end this delicious brunch, we had the lemon cheesecake to share. If you love cheesecake and lemon meringue tart, you have to try this one. It's the perfect mix of both, it is to die for!
Joli café , terrasse agreable, belle fenestration, boutique avec produits derivés Ricardo à coté. Vous avez l'acceuil de Ricardo lui meme en carton grandeur grevin devant la porte ...
